The International School of Moscow Part of The British Schools Group
Term 2 Week 6 Friday 21st February 2014
Dear Parents,
International week was amazing! The children loved all the countries they studied. Thank you so much for coming in and helping with all the activities. The food was amazing and it was lovely to try different food from all over the world.
Literacy.
Remember to work on the sounds and the words over the holiday.
Maths.
In Maths we have been learning about currencies from different countries and focusing on the currency of the country that our class is studying for International week.
Music: Reception have learnt a song as part of International Week, which includes greetings in different languages from around the world.
Russian:
Reception Russian - Beginners
This week in the Russian lessons Reception students in the Beginners group continued studying “Fruits and vegetable” topic enjoying, role playing a Russian song and performing it for another group.
Miss O. Semisotnova
Russian Reception - Continuer
This week in the Reception continuer group we carried on learning the current vocabulary list and learnt some of the animal (dinosaur) body parts like claws, long legs, horns and the construction: He has … and he likes apples, he can run.
Miss N.Shiryaeva
Reception Russian – Advanced 1
This week the pupils in the Russian Advanced group have been learning about different sports in the Winter Olympics Sochi'14. They've been making their own sportsmen and developing clothing for them. Miss M. Terekhina
Reception Russian – Advanced 2
This week in Russian lessons students in advanced group 2 reinforced the topic of clothes and discussed different types of clothing (for sport, for school, for work).
We also wrote the letter “P”. Miss G. Shapovalova
Many thanks again for your continued support.
Have a fantastic holiday!
The Reception Team
The International School of Moscow World Class Education
